# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + (current_line == "" ? 0 : 1) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if current_line != ""
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)  # Add the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language for technical computing."
println(wrap_string(text))
```
This function `wrap_string` takes a string `text` and optionally a `text_width` argument which defaults to 10. It splits the text into words, then iteratively constructs lines that do not exceed the given `text_width`, and joins these lines with newline characters (`\n`).
